title: Patient and Family Resources
description: Stanford Health Care delivers the highest levels of care and compassion. SHC treats cancer, heart disease, brain disorders, primary care issues, and many more.
cleaned_text: Patient and Family Resources Patient and Family Resources Medical Forms A resource of medical forms to complete before for your procedure. Please download and use to prepare for your appointment. Patient Drop-off and Parking To keep everyone safe from COVID-19 infection, a limited number of [visitors](https://stanfordhealthcare.org/discover/covid-19-resource-center/your-visit/visitor-policy.html) are allowed at this time in Stanford Health Care facilities. Patient Resources You have many resources and services available to you. We are here to support you, keep you safe and help you stay informed. Visitor Resources We have compiled a list of activities, restaurants, and lodging for the visitors and family members of our patients. What to Expect During Your Stay Obtain guidance on how to prepare for your hospital visit. Our policies on COVID-19 prevention will help you stay safe and connected with friends and family during your stay. Planning for Care After You Leave the Hospital Your care team will work with you and your caregiver to plan your care once you leave the hospital. Latest Updates - The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention now recommends individuals 6 months and older receive the updated bivalent COVID-19 vaccine. Doses vary depending on age and vaccination status. In addition, adults 65 and older can now get a second bivalent booster. See our [vaccines page](https://stanfordhealthcare.org/discover/covid-19-resource-center/vaccines-testing/covid-19-vaccines.html)for details. - In alignment with the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) and local counties, as well as the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), booster shots are no longer required for health care workers. However, we will still require health care workers to receive the primary series of the COVID-19 vaccine. - New guidelines on masking: see our [Visitor Policy](https://stanfordhealthcare.org/discover/covid-19-resource-center/your-visit/visitor-policy.html)for details - Our drive-thru testing and vaccination sites have closed for the season.
